New Records: Andrew Wiggins scored a game-high 29 points and made a game-best five 3-pointers in the Warriors' 112-104 loss to the Los Angeles Clippers.
Key Match Events: The Clippers had a 20-point advantage in paint points (58-38)
Buddy Hield hit a baseline jumper for his first home basket at Chase Center
Hield sank a deep three despite being fouled and falling into the front row of Dub Nation fans
Hield used his dribble penetration to find Trayce Jackson-Davis for an alley-oop slam, capping an 8-0 Warriors run to cut the deficit to just one point (43-42)
Stephen Curry hurt his left ankle late in the third quarter of Sunday's contest and re-injured the same ankle early in the fourth quarter, forcing him to be sidelined for the remainder of the game.
Pre-Game Insights: No specific pre-game insights were provided.
Post-Match Reflections: Andrew Wiggins scored at least nine points in three different quarters, including shooting a perfect 4-for-4 in the third quarter and his highest-scoring 11-point fourth quarter on 4-for-5 shooting.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kevon Looney recorded a double-double off the bench with 10 points and 11 rebounds in 20 minutes.
The Clippers went on an 11-0 run in the second quarter before the Warriors' newfound offensive ignitor, Buddy Hield, helped them battle back.
Others: The Warriors will host the New Orleans Pelicans for a home back-to-back on Tuesday and Wednesday.
